description: From Latin substans, substantis, present participle of substare (“to be firm”).

adjectives.description: substant (comparative more substant, superlative most substant)

examples: [The glacier's] substant ice curls freely, molds, and breaks itself like water, — breaks in waves, plastic like honey, crested lightly with a frozen spray; it winds tenderly about the rocky shore, and the granite, disintegrated into crumbs, flows on with it.
